analysis.pld_accountant module¶

Paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.03049 Referenced code from: https://github.com/DPBayes/PLD-Accountant

analysis.pld_accountant.compute_online_privacy_from_ledger(ledger, F_prod, target_delta=None, target_eps=None, adjacency_definition='add_remove', nx=1000000.0, L=50.0)[source]¶

Compute new PLD privacy in an online fashion, to speed up computation.

Parameters

ledger – The ledger of queries to compute for. An incremental ledger,

NOT the whole ledger. :param target_eps: A target epsilon to aim for. :param target_delta: A target delta to aim for. :param adjacency_definition: The definition of adjacent datasets to use. Can be ‘add_remove’ or ‘substitution’ :param nx: The number of discretisation points to use. :param L: The range truncation parameter :return:

analysis.pld_accountant.compute_privacy_loss_from_ledger(ledger, target_eps=None, target_delta=None, adjacency_definition='add_remove', nx=1000000.0, L=50.0)[source]¶

Compute the privacy loss of the queries entered into a ledger using the Gaussian Mechanism utilising an approximation to the true privacy bound (https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.03049) with one of epsilon or delta fixed.

Parameters

  • ledger – The ledger of queries to compute for

  • target_eps – A target epsilon to aim for.

  • target_delta – A target delta to aim for.

  • adjacency_definition – The definition of adjacent datasets to use. Can be

‘add_remove’ or ‘substitution’ :param nx: The number of discretisation points to use. :param L: The range truncation parameter :return: epsilon, delta

analysis.pld_accountant.get_FF1_add_remove[source]¶

For a single Gaussian Mechanism, compute the FFT approximation points for the privacy loss distribution, under the addition/removal adjacency definition. :param sigma: The effective noise applied :param q: The sample probability :param nx: The number of approximation points :param L: The clipping length of the approximation :return: The FFT approximation points

analysis.pld_accountant.get_FF1_substitution[source]¶

For a single Gaussian Mechanism, compute the FFT approximation points for the privacy loss distribution, under the substitution adjacency definition. :param sigma: The effective noise applied :param q: The sample probability :param nx: The number of approximation points :param L: The clipping length of the approximation :return: The FFT approximation points

analysis.pld_accountant.get_delta_add_remove(effective_z_t, q_t, target_eps=1.0, nx=1000000.0, L=20.0, F_prod=None)[source]¶

Computes the approximation of the exact privacy as per https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.03049 for a fixed epsilon, for a list of given mechanisms applied. Considers neighbouring sets as those with the addition/removal property.

Parameters

  • effective_z_t – 1D numpy array of the effective noises applied in the mechanisms.

  • q_t – 1D numpy array of the selection probabilities of the data used in the mechanisms.

  • target_eps – The target epsilon to aim for.

  • nx – The number of discretisation points to use.

  • L – The range truncation parameter

  • F_prod – Specify a previous F_prod for computing online accountancy. If none, assume not

online. :return: (epsilon, delta) privacy bound.

analysis.pld_accountant.get_delta_substitution(effective_z_t, q_t, target_eps=1.0, nx=1000000.0, L=20.0, F_prod=None)[source]¶

Computes the approximation of the exact privacy as per https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.03049 for a fixed epsilon, for a list of given mechanisms applied. Considers neighbouring sets as those with the substitution property.

Parameters

  • effective_z_t – 1D numpy array of the effective noises applied in the mechanisms.

  • q_t – 1D numpy array of the selection probabilities of the data used in the mechanisms.

  • target_eps – The target epsilon to aim for.

  • nx – The number of discretisation points to use.

  • L – The range truncation parameter

  • F_prod – Specify a previous F_prod for computing online accountancy. If none, assume not

online. :return: (epsilon, delta) privacy bound.

analysis.pld_accountant.get_eps_add_remove(effective_z_t, q_t, target_delta=1e-06, nx=1000000.0, L=20.0, F_prod=None)[source]¶

Computes the approximation of the exact privacy as per https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.03049 for a fixed epsilon, for a list of given mechanisms applied. Considers neighbouring sets as those with the addition/removal property.

Parameters

  • effective_z_t – 1D numpy array of the effective noises applied in the mechanisms.

  • q_t – 1D numpy array of the selection probabilities of the data used in the mechanisms.

  • target_delta – The target delta to aim for.

  • nx – The number of discretisation points to use.

  • L – The range truncation parameter

  • F_prod – Specify a previous F_prod for computing online accountancy. If none, assume not

online. :return: (epsilon, delta) privacy bound.

analysis.pld_accountant.get_eps_add_remove_fixed_params(target_delta=1e-06, sigma=2.0, q=0.01, ncomp=10000.0, nx=1000000.0, L=20.0)[source]¶
analysis.pld_accountant.get_eps_substitution(effective_z_t, q_t, target_delta=1e-06, nx=1000000.0, L=20.0, F_prod=None)[source]¶

Computes the approximation of the exact privacy as per https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.03049 for a fixed epsilon, for a list of given mechanisms applied. Considers neighbouring sets as those with the substitution property.

Parameters

  • effective_z_t – 1D numpy array of the effective noises applied in the mechanisms.

  • q_t – 1D numpy array of the selection probabilities of the data used in the mechanisms.

  • target_delta – The target delta to aim for.

  • nx – The number of discretisation points to use.

  • L – The range truncation parameter

  • F_prod – Specify a previous F_prod for computing online accountancy. If none, assume not

online. :return: (epsilon, delta) privacy bound.
